page.title: 01TOW LAW & DISTRICT,DURHAM.
page.content:
{ Tow Law{is a former pit village with {roughly 2,220 people living here at {the moment.It was built 1,000ft above {sea level overlooking the valley of {the River Wear. The fortnightly cattle {mart attracts farmers from many miles {around, especially in Spring and {Autumn. { {Sunniside,}a mile to the east, also owes it's existence to coal. Just off the main road a{miner's handball court still stands as evidence of the past.
After the collieries disappeared much of the surrounding land was open-cast and then returned to grazing land. Farmers now keep many cows and sheep on land which was once crossed by some of the earliest railways in the world.
